title: GE Appliances 9-to-5 Timesheet Review & Evaluation Dashboard
description: Two-step internal tool: (1) immediately show every raw CSV row in a paginated, searchable table so managers can eyeball the 9-to-5 entries before analysis, (2) on-demand analytics that calculate performance KPIs, charts and printable PDFs assuming a fixed 08:00–17:00 schedule with 60 min lunch.

pages.name: Landing
pages.purpose: Minimalist entry point with GE-blue upload button, live progress bar, instant full-data preview table, and a secondary 'Analyse' button that is disabled until data is reviewed

pages.name: Dashboard
pages.purpose: Post-review analytics: KPI cards, aggregated employee table, accessible charts, and a 'Back to raw data' link

pages.name: Reports
pages.purpose: Print-optimised, paginated view for generating individual PDF evaluations

ui_components: File upload button (GE blue #005CB9, white Nunito-Sans label)
Inline error alert with downloadable error log
Raw data table with column filters, global search, pagination (25/50/100/all)
Eyeball-review checkbox 'I have reviewed the data' to unlock 'Analyse' action
Sortable aggregated employee stats table with sticky headers & keyboard nav
Off-canvas help panel with bilingual keyboard shortcuts
state: rawRows: array of unaltered CSV rows
filteredRows: array after column filters & search
employees: aggregated metrics per employee (populated only after 'Analyse')
kpis: workforce totals, averages, overtime count (populated only after 'Analyse')
interactions: Raw data table rendered immediately after successful parse
Raw and aggregated table sort & keyboard nav
Keyboard shortcuts: U for upload, R for reports, / for search
acceptance_criteria: Upload button styled #005CB9 with white Nunito-Sans label
CSV required columns validated: employee_id, name, date, clock_in, clock_out
Duplicates flagged with downloadable error log
Raw data table shows every row (paginated), immediately after parse, before any analysis
Eyeball-review checkbox must be ticked to enable 'Analyse' button
Metrics calculated only after 'Analyse': total hrs, avg daily hrs, days worked, punctuality, overtime flag (fixed 8 h threshold)
KPI cards show workforce totals, averages, overtime count
Raw and aggregated tables sortable, sticky headers, row hover, keyboard nav
Charts use GE palette with pattern fills & 200% zoom labels
Aria-labels bilingual en/es, WCAG 2.2 AA focus outlines
Keyboard shortcuts documented in off-canvas help
